name: Camunda 8 (SaaS/Self-Managed)
description: Our primary engine for high-throughput process orchestration. Essential for state management in complex AI agent handoffs.

name: Model Context Protocol (MCP)
description: Standardized protocol for connecting AI agents to local/remote data sources. Crucial for vendor-agnostic agent tooling.

name: LangGraph
description: The preferred framework for building cyclic, stateful multi-agent systems. Replaces basic LangChain chains for complex logic.

name: NeMo Guardrails
description: Standard for enforcing safety and topicality in LLM interactions, ensuring 'Government-grade' security and reliability.

name: Human-in-the-Loop (HITL) BPMN Patterns
description: Using Camunda User Tasks to validate AI-generated outputs before final commitment to system-of-record.

name: CrewAI
description: Evaluating for role-based autonomous agent orchestration where rigid BPMN might be too restrictive.

name: Pinecone Serverless
description: The default vector database for RAG implementations due to its low ops overhead and cost-scaling model.

name: PydanticAI
description: Using Pydantic's type safety for LLM structured outputs. Improves developer experience and runtime reliability.

name: Temporal.io
description: Assessing as an alternative to Camunda for developer-centric, code-first durable execution without BPMN overhead.

name: Embedded Camunda 7 Engines
description: Phasing out in favor of Camunda 8. No new projects should use embedded Spring Boot C7 architectures.
